intro: Jacquemontia lasioclados, commonly known as the woolly morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Jacquemontia lasioclados is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other morning glory species.
